availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Watts. Father of Garret J. Watts. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 243A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2, p. 470.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2, p. 133.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 1, p. 407A.
